channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: 'Everyone will be frustrated' about uncooperative Covid-positive case - Ashley Bloomfield
item.description: The Director-General of Health said the situation was "very challenging" but says it is reassuring that woman she had been travelling with has now been located.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Tyson Fury fears for Deontay Wilder: 'Shots like that end careers'
item.description: Big Brit continues party in Vegas but has concerns for pummeled rival.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: State cash continues to prop up tourism businesses
item.description: The Government has dealt out $3.9 billion in subsidies since the Delta outbreak began and tourism and travel operators are keen users.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS MARSHALL

item.title: The Guard at 10: Why it's still the greatest black comedy of the last decade
item.description: REVIEW: John Michael McDonagh's tale is filled with colourful characters, memorable set pieces, great one-liners and a brilliant Brendan Gleeson.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: The Alpinist: Fascinating, fear-inducing look at a man who rose to great heights
item.description: REVIEW: While perhaps a more cautionary tale then Free Solo, this will leave you equally, if not more, awestruck by Marc-André Leclerc’s exploits.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Pressure put on Whanganui Homeless Hub as council meets with residents
item.description: Reisdents and organisers of Covid-inspired solution for Whanganui's homeless left with questions after meeting with council.
item.dc:creator: JONO GALUSZKA

item.title: Wellington today, October 12: Staff shortage bites for Wellington maternity, old Ronald McDonald House letter revealed
item.description: Here’s what you need to know from The Dominion Post today, plus breaking news and events from around the capital.
item.dc:creator: WELLINGTON REPORTERS

item.title: Kiwi-built electric moped hitting the streets
item.description: A Wellington start-up has launched its gorgeous new electric moped, aimed at tackling urban mobility in style.
item.dc:creator: NILE BIJOUX

item.title: Disabled Taranaki elderly depending on carers who sometimes do not show
item.description: Doug Wilson has one leg and relies on in-home carers to give him his medication and help with everyday tasks – but he says there are days they don't turn up.
item.dc:creator: JANE MATTHEWS

item.title: Half of Taranaki population now fully protected against Covid-19
item.description: A record week of vaccinations saw 15,600 doses administered last week.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Lamb: Iceland's dark answer to Stuart Little is a film not easily forgotten
item.description: REVIEW: This is a haunting rural tale whose horrors are heightened by the day-to-day domesticity it effectively portrays.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT

item.title: Meetings between Family Court judge and Oranga Tamariki raise questions
item.description: Judges say meetings about administration are needed for efficient operation of courts
item.dc:creator: MARTY SHARPE

item.title: Ebert Construction receivership comes up short; unsecured creditors owed $124m
item.description: PwC receiver Lara Bennett says it is distressing the receivers weren't able to recover all the money owed.
item.dc:creator: TINA MORRISON

item.title: Most investors in cryptocurrency will lose money
item.description: OPINION: As someone who’s seen many investment fads, I think most retail investors will lose money from cryptocurrencies.
item.dc:creator: SAM STUBBS

item.title: Covid-19: The man, the mission, and what to do about MIQ
item.description: OPINION: The shortfall in available rooms in managed isolation pre-Christmas could leave thousands out in the cold.
item.dc:creator: TODD NIALL

item.title: Quiz: Morning trivia challenge: October 12, 2021
item.description: In the movie "Big" what does Tom Hanks' character play on the giant piano?
item.dc:creator: SHAHRA HUME

item.title: More vaccine mandates welcome - now what about the borders?
item.description: OPINION: It will take a stauncher Government approach to domestic borders to staunch Delta's seepage out of Auckland.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: When straight talk was needed, Jacinda wasn't there
item.description: OPINION: On any other politician indecision would look normal, but on the Prime Minister it looks weak. And that’s how it looked last week.
item.dc:creator: VERITY JOHNSON

item.title: Covid-19: The world of the unvaccinated is only going to shrink from now
item.description: ANALYSIS: The direction of travel is now clear: If you don't get vaccinated, your life will be very different to your fellow citizens — and the Government is ok with that.
item.dc:creator: LUKE MALPASS

item.title: Facebook bans NZ period underwear ad over use of real blood
item.description: The social media giant says the 90-second clip violates its "shock and scare" policy.
item.dc:creator: ESTHER TAUNTON
